actor_awards.notes: Despite his immense popularity and iconic roles, Flynn was never nominated for an Academy Award.

filmography.title: Captain Blood
filmography.role_description: An Irish physician wrongly convicted of treason who escapes slavery to become a chivalrous pirate in the Caribbean.
filmography.plot: A doctor is wrongly sentenced to slavery in the Caribbean, where he and his fellow prisoners escape to become the most feared pirates on the seas.

filmography.title: The Charge of the Light Brigade
filmography.role_description: A noble British officer in India who sacrifices his career and life to avenge a massacre, leading the infamous cavalry charge.
filmography.plot: A British major betrays his regiment and his brother by romancing his brother's fiancée, leading to the infamous charge during the Crimean War.

filmography.title: The Prince and the Pauper
filmography.role_description: A dashing soldier of fortune who befriends a pauper boy who has switched places with the Prince of Wales.
filmography.plot: A poor boy and a prince exchange identities, but events force the pauper to live the life of a king while the prince endures the hardships of the streets.

filmography.title: The Adventures of Robin Hood
filmography.role_description: The legendary Saxon outlaw who robs from the rich to give to the poor and fights against the tyranny of Prince John.
filmography.plot: When Prince John begins oppressing the Saxon commoners in King Richard's absence, a Saxon lord fights back as the outlaw leader of a rebel guerrilla army.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Art Direction, Best Editing, Best Original Score

filmography.title: The Dawn Patrol
filmography.role_description: A gallant but weary flight commander in WWI who must send young, inexperienced pilots to their deaths.
filmography.plot: In World War I, two British flying officers must deal with the stress of losing their comrades and the pressure of command.

filmography.title: The Sisters
filmography.role_description: A charming but self-destructive sports reporter whose alcoholism threatens his marriage during the 1906 San Francisco earthquake.
filmography.plot: Three sisters' lives take different paths in the early 1900s; one marries a flighty reporter who abandons her during the San Francisco earthquake.

filmography.title: Dodge City
filmography.role_description: A cattle agent who reluctantly becomes sheriff to clean up the lawless town of Dodge City.
filmography.plot: A Texas cattle agent witnesses the brutal lawlessness of Dodge City and takes the job of sheriff to clean the town up.

filmography.title: The Private Lives of Elizabeth and Essex
filmography.role_description: The ambitious and hot-headed favorite of Queen Elizabeth I, whose thirst for power leads to a tragic conflict with the crown.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the volatile relationship between the aging Queen Elizabeth I and the ambitious Earl of Essex.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Art Direction, Best Cinematography

filmography.title: Virginia City
filmography.role_description: A Union intelligence officer who escapes a Confederate prison to stop a shipment of gold intended to save the Confederacy.
filmography.plot: A Union officer escapes from a Confederate prison and goes to Nevada to stop a gold shipment from reaching the South.

filmography.title: The Sea Hawk
filmography.role_description: A daring English privateer based on Sir Francis Drake who raids Spanish ships to protect England from the Armada.
filmography.plot: Geoffrey Thorpe, a buccaneer, is hired by Queen Elizabeth I to nag the Spanish Armada. The Armada is waiting for the attack on England and Thorpe surprises them with attacks on their galleons.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Art Direction, Best Sound, Best Effects, Best Music

filmography.title: Santa Fe Trail
filmography.role_description: A future Confederate general portrayed as a young West Point graduate fighting abolitionist John Brown in Kansas.
filmography.plot: In 1854, Jeb Stuart and George Custer are assigned to the Kansas territory to stop the abolitionist John Brown.

filmography.title: Footsteps in the Dark
filmography.role_description: A wealthy investment banker who leads a secret double life as a mystery novelist and amateur detective.
filmography.plot: A man writes mystery novels under a pseudonym and gets involved in a real murder case to the dismay of the police.

filmography.title: Dive Bomber
filmography.role_description: A flight surgeon dedicated to solving the problem of pilot blackouts, working alongside skeptical naval aviators.
filmography.plot: A crusading scientist fights to solve the problem of pilot blackout in the era of new high-speed aircraft.

filmography.title: They Died with Their Boots On
filmography.role_description: A flamboyant and highly fictionalized portrayal of General Custer, from his days at West Point to his last stand at Little Bighorn.
filmography.plot: A fictionalized account of the life of General George Custer, from his days at West Point to his death at the Little Bighorn.
filmography.awards: Final Film with Olivia de Havilland

filmography.title: Desperate Journey
filmography.role_description: An RAF flight lieutenant who leads his downed bomber crew on a daring escape through Nazi Germany.
filmography.plot: When their bomber crashes in Germany, the five surviving crew members must fight their way out of the country.

filmography.title: Gentleman Jim
filmography.role_description: The charismatic bank teller who becomes the heavyweight boxing champion of the world, introducing a scientific style to the sport.
filmography.plot: The biography of 19th-century heavyweight boxing champion James J. Corbett.

filmography.title: Edge of Darkness
filmography.role_description: A Norwegian fisherman and resistance leader who organizes a revolt against the Nazi occupation of his village.
filmography.plot: A Norwegian fishing village rises up and revolts against the occupying Nazis.

filmography.title: Northern Pursuit
filmography.role_description: A Canadian Mountie of German descent who goes undercover to capture a Nazi saboteur in the Canadian wilderness.
filmography.plot: A Mountie feigns treason to infiltrate a ring of Nazi saboteurs planning to destroy a canal.

filmography.title: Uncertain Glory
filmography.role_description: A convicted murderer in France who escapes the guillotine and seeks redemption by sacrificing himself to save hostages from the Nazis.
filmography.plot: A criminal about to be executed escapes during a bombing raid and tries to make a deal to save 100 hostages.

filmography.title: Objective, Burma!
filmography.role_description: An American paratrooper captain who leads a platoon on a dangerous mission to destroy a Japanese radar station in Burma.
filmography.plot: A group of U.S. soldiers are dropped into enemy-held Burma to destroy a radar station, but the mission becomes a fight for survival.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Film Editing, Best Score, Best Story

filmography.title: San Antonio
filmography.role_description: A rancher who returns to Texas to expose a ring of cattle rustlers and win the heart of a saloon singer.
filmography.plot: A rancher hunts for the head of a cattle rustling ring, armed with a ledger that proves the man's guilt.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Art Direction, Best Original Song

filmography.title: Never Say Goodbye
filmography.role_description: A successful artist and playboy who tries to win back his ex-wife and daughter in this romantic comedy.
filmography.plot: A divorced man tries to win back his ex-wife before she marries another man, using their daughter as an accomplice.

filmography.title: Cry Wolf
filmography.role_description: A mysterious and seemingly sinister scientist who controls a family estate, clashing with a woman claiming to be his nephew's widow.
filmography.plot: A woman uncovers a dark secret when she visits the estate of her late husband's family to claim her inheritance.

filmography.title: Silver River
filmography.role_description: A dishonorably discharged Union officer who becomes a ruthless silver baron in Nevada, alienating everyone around him.
filmography.plot: A cashiered Union officer becomes a ruthless gambling hall owner and silver baron in the West.

filmography.title: Adventures of Don Juan
filmography.role_description: The legendary Spanish lover who redeems himself by saving the Queen of Spain from the Duke of Lorca's plotting.
filmography.plot: The great lover Don Juan comes to the aid of his queen to expose a plot by a treacherous duke.

filmography.title: Kim
filmography.role_description: A Red-bearded horse trader and British spy in 19th-century India who mentors the young orphan Kim.
filmography.plot: A street orphan in British India becomes the disciple of a Tibetan lama while working for British intelligence.

filmography.title: The Master of Ballantrae
filmography.role_description: A Scottish nobleman who turns pirate after the Jacobite rising of 1745 and returns home to reclaim his inheritance.
filmography.plot: A Scottish lord fights for Bonnie Prince Charlie, becomes a pirate, and returns to claim his estate from his brother.

filmography.title: The Sun Also Rises
filmography.role_description: A bankrupt, heavy-drinking Scottish war veteran in a film adaptation of Hemingway's novel, earning Flynn critical acclaim late in his career.
filmography.plot: A group of disillusioned American expatriate writers live a dissolute, hedonistic lifestyle in France and Spain in the 1920s.

filmography.title: Too Much, Too Soon
filmography.role_description: A poignant portrayal of his real-life friend and idol, the alcoholic acting legend John Barrymore.
filmography.plot: A biopic of actress Diana Barrymore, focusing on her turbulent relationship with her famous father, John Barrymore.
